content: hello friends and fellow crafters welcome to the DMS craft today I'm going
to show you a cool craft we're making barrels for your games and a trick with
barrels is they're kind of curved it kind of curved in so it can be tricky to
craft those but I have a really super easy and cheap way to do it so let's go
the table I'll show you how I did it now here's the material I used to start
and it's very thin cardboard this is a priority mail envelope and this was a
another competitor envelope and you can see that it's very got some very thin
corrugation on the side okay so this is with a key to this project
so what I did was I looked at the corrugation you kind of see it in the
light here and I took a pen and I just marked between each corrugation okay and
I just went down the entire side marked all the corrugation on one side and then
I turned it over and to the other side and so I've got it on each side and then
I used a ruler and just drew across the corrugation so this will help me cut
these lines so I can get the boarding effect that I'm going after so I'm just
using a small box cutter just cutting the first layer okay I didn't cut
through all the way I just cut that first layer and you can see it flex
there so now what I'm going to do is I'm going to measure the barrels out so I
need the barrels are gonna be an inch tall okay and they'll be a little
shorter than that once we do some the other technique on them so I measured an
inch for each barrel and then I'm going to measure a quarter of an inch from the
top top and bottom of each inch and you'll see why I do that in a minute so
I'm going to draw the lines on there so I can have a guide when I cut this out
so I'll got all the guides on there my ruler and now I'll just cut those two
I've got actually got two barrels out coming out of this sheet or two rows of
barrels coming out of this sheet so let's cut that and you can see it's
ready to go so now you can see it flexes very nicely but I haven't pierced the
second layer okay and that's what's the key to this project so now I'm going to
count in 12 corrugation links and kind of twist it around I'm going to cut from
the top and bottom to that line not past just so those are flexible and
then I'll bend each one okay and then I'm bending them in so I just got the
crease on there and I'm bending them in so now I've got a piece with the top and
the bottom bent inward okay so now I can just flex that so it comes into a circle
a tube alright and then just connect the two ends so I'm going to use a PR so you
some hot glue and put it on the end there and just hold it so it it hardens
up and it's ready to go now I need to cover the top and the bottom of the
barrel so when you use the same thin cardboard and I had this piece this
circular game piece and I'm going to use that to measure but it's actually the
circle size is five eighths of an inch all right so I'm just going to cut those
out and so I've got my disks now I'm going to put one on the bottom and one
problem I'm going to have with this is the weight okay so what I want to do is
put a bolt in the bottom of this and that'll give it some weight because it's
just paper it's going to fly all over the place so I'll put some hot glue in
there generous portion of hot glue drop the bolt in there and then you can just
push it down with a toothpick to make sure it's flat on the bottom it almost
be like a weeble if you're familiar with those toys it'll it'll give it weight on
the bottom there okay and this will keep it from just flying around and falling
all over the place when you when you have it on the tile so I'll just pop the
top on and you can see it that it has weight in there and it won't fall over
quite as easily all right now I spray paint these black with flat black paint
and I'm going to use a burnt umber and just paint all of these up and they're
all set I let them dry now I've got a Mississippi mud here it's kind of a just
a kind of a muddy brown and I'm just going to paint the barrels I want to
make sure I accentuate the the the ribbing of the barrels
okay don't cover that up so paint all those barrels
nice wood texture on there and now I'm going to use a light gray I want to do
some aging on that so I'm just going to put a little bit of touch a light gray
on there and that will give a little bit of aging to the wood it'll look like
it's aged wood and you see I'm not covering that up I'm just hitting it
splashing across it almost to give it to that look alright there we go nice
looking aged barrels right there one last detail I want to do is the banding
okay so I'm going to use a thin piece of thin cardstock that you would run
through a printer okay and you know with a banding I'm just going to measure this
an eighth of an inch and with the banding you could paint that on there if
you want but I think this really looks great I think it's worth the time okay
so I cut the strips out I'm going to use a metallic black okay I'll paint the
painting strip I'm just using a pad so I don't make a mess of my surface there
alright and let those dry for a minute and now I'm going to use a burnt umber
to kind of give it like a little bit of a rust on it so that's kind of nice it
gives it a little more detail and now I've got my barrel okay and you see kind
of the marks where I've got I marked it on when I cut it you know going around
the barrel there so I'll put some white glue around it and then wrap my piece of
banding around and I prefer using the white glue because the hot glue is
really it's hard to do with this small detail okay and I'll do the other
banding I'll just keep going around and finish up the banding and just hold it
long enough that it will stick and you'll be set so there we go there's one
barrel got my got the rest to do and I'll be set for our tavern so here I
have my tap in for tile and I'm going to set it up I got the bar there start
putting the tables chairs everything in there got a fireplace got my barrels
that are made for this video got some servers patrons and of course you have
to have the party so there at the table but unfortunately for them their repast
is interrupted by some assassins that have come to hate them for supporting
their evil plans so they surround the party and it looks
like a dangerous bar fight is about to ensue alright so here we go there's the
setup and give me a look at those barrels they came out really really
great look how good they look that bandy looks fantastic they got that curve like
a barrel should have and that bolt inside really holds them up nicely also
the characters can stand on them so that's kind of cool so you can do a
stunt where you can jump up on the barrel fight you know fight from the
barrel so fun stuff fun stuff also I got stables doors chairs fireplaces and I
have videos all this stuff so make sure you check it out Oh
Roderick not feel so good Roderick drink too much
